NOTICE OF EX PARTE COMMUNICATION BY  ALLIANCE FOR RETAIL ENERGY MARKETS Pursuant to Rules 8.2 and 8.2(c)(2) of the California Public Utilities Commission Rules of Practice and Procedure, the Alliance for Retail Energy Markets (AReM) hereby provides notice of  a  meeting  with  Nick  Dahlberg,  Advisor  to  President Alice  Busching  Reynolds,  and Amin Younes, Advisor to Commissioner John Reynolds, on Friday, May 16, 2025.  The meeting took place from approximately 1:30 P.M. to 2:00 P.M. via Webex.  Cem  Turhal,  Director  of  Regulatory  Affairs,  Direct  Energy  Business  /  NRG,  and  Mary  Neal of MRW & Associates, Consultant to AReM participated by Webex on behalf of AReM.  The topic of the discussion was the upcoming Track 3 proposed decision.  AReM expressed its  opposition  to  the  use  of  waivers  for  system  RA  compliance,  instead  supporting  the  Staff  proposal  to  maintain  the  17%  planning  reserve  margin  (PRM)  plus  an  effective  reserve  margin.  AReM supports the 17% PRM without waivers as a more equitable solution that protects affordability  and  reliability  and  also  expressed  its  support  for  continuing  efforts  to  improve  modeling to achieve consensus on the PRM necessary to achieve a 0.1 loss of load expectation AReM also discussed  its  support  for  hourly  obligation  trading,  stating that hourly obligation trading provided load serving entities flexibility to achieve compliance with slice-of-day obligations cost-effectively while protecting reliability. The attached handout was shared at the meeting.
